total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grid. The pattern seems to be a repeating sequence of numbers (1, 2, 5, 1, 8, 2, 1) in each row, with some rows having a sequence of zeros in the middle.
Q2: Determine the length of the repeating sequence before the zeros start.
Q3: Identify the position where the zeros start in the rows that contain zeros.
Q4: Determine the length of the sequence of zeros.
Q5: Identify the sequence that follows the zeros in the rows that contain zeros.
Q6: Determine if the sequence that follows the zeros is a continuation of the initial repeating sequence.

Q7: Identify the pattern in the output grid. The pattern seems to be the same repeating sequence of numbers (1, 2, 5, 1, 8, 2, 1) in each row, with the zeros replaced by a continuation of the sequence.
Q8: Determine the rule for replacing the zeros with the sequence of numbers.
Q9: Apply the rule to the input grid to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grid. The pattern seems to be a repeating sequence of numbers (1, 2, 5, 1, 8, 2, 1) in each row, with some rows having a sequence of zeros in the middle.
Q2: Determine the length of the repeating sequence before the zeros appear.
Q3: Identify the position where the zeros start in the rows that contain zeros.
Q4: Determine the length of the sequence of zeros.
Q5: Identify the pattern in the sequence after the zeros.
Q6: Determine if the pattern before the zeros continues after the zeros.
Q7: Identify the pattern in the rows that do not contain zeros.
Q8: Determine if the pattern in the rows without zeros is the same as the pattern in the rows with zeros, excluding the zeros.
Q9: Based on the patterns identified, predict the pattern in the output grid.
